plants.name: Prunus serrulata
plants.description: A deciduous tree known for its spectacular display of pink to white flowers that signal the arrival of spring in Japan and many temperate regions. It holds cultural significance and is celebrated with festivals called Hanami.
plants.location: Japan, temperate zones in Northern Hemisphere
plants.funFact: The blooming of cherry blossoms is so significant in Japan that it is monitored closely, and forecasts are made annually to predict the best viewing times.

plants.name: Erythrina crista-galli
plants.description: A small to medium-sized tree that produces vibrant red flowers shaped somewhat like cockscombs. It is popular in subtropical and tropical regions and valued for its ornamental beauty.
plants.bloomingSeason: Late summer to early autumn in Northern Hemisphere; in some Southern Hemisphere locations it blooms around March to April
plants.location: Native to South America, cultivated in subtropical regions worldwide
plants.funFact: Erythrina crista-galli is the national flower of Argentina and Uruguay.

plants.name: Magnolia Ã— soulangeana
plants.description: A hybrid magnolia that produces large, tulip-shaped flowers ranging from white to deep pink. It is widely planted in temperate gardens and blooms early in the spring, often before leaves emerge.
plants.location: Cultivated widely in temperate regions across both hemispheres
plants.funFact: Saucer Magnolia is a hybrid between Magnolia denudata and Magnolia liliiflora and was first bred in France in the 1820s.

plants.name: Banksia integrifolia
plants.description: An Australian native tree well known for its cylindrical golden flower spikes that provide nectar for birds and insects. It blooms mostly in the warmer months, including early autumn in Australia which aligns with April in the Southern Hemisphere.
plants.funFact: Banksias play a vital ecological role as a food source for nectar-feeding animals and are adapted to survive bushfires.
